etymology.description: 衣(衣) (yī, 'clothing') + phonetic: 因(因) (yīn, 'cause') = cloth-like item -> mat
etymology.interpretation: The character 裀(yīn, 'mat') combines 衣(衣) (yī, 'clothing'), symbolizing textiles or cloth materials, with 因(因) (yīn, 'cause') as a phonetic component. This indicates an object made of cloth, fitting for the definition of 'mat.'
